Job Title: Supply Chain Planning and Reporting Manager
Ad Text:
This is a newly created leadership opportunity with a high-performing, national retail business undergoing significant transformation. Backed by executive-level sponsorship and strong investment in technology, systems, and capability, this role has been designed to fuel business growth and lift the standard of supply chain excellence across the network.

The Opportunity:
In this high-impact role, you’ll be responsible for bringing together key inputs from Merchandise, Online and Fulfilment teams and translating them into executable operational plans across the national DC and store network. You’ll lead the end-to-end planning function while developing and delivering a purpose-built reporting suite that enhances visibility, supports better decisions, and ensures alignment across the broader supply chain.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and lead a national supply chain planning framework aligned to merchandise and online fulfilment strategies.
Work with cross-functional partners to deliver rolling forecasts and translate these into actionable operational plans.
Drive visibility and accountability of volume and capacity across DCs, transport, and stores.
Own and lead seasonal planning cycles, key events, and product launch readiness.
Proactively identify, communicate, and mitigate volume flow risks across the network.
Build and lead a high-performing team of Supply Chain Analysts.
Design and implement a centralised reporting suite tracking all major supply chain KPIs.
Partner closely with DC Operations, Inventory, Merchandise, and Ecomm teams to ensure alignment and execution.
What We’re Looking For:

Strong experience in a complex, high-volume Retail, FMCG or Online environment.
Strong background in volume planning, demand forecasting and supply chain reporting.
Proven leadership experience with the ability to develop and scale a high-performing team.
Excellent Excel and reporting/ Power BI dashboard development skills.
Experience with planning systems/tools highly regarded.
Tertiary qualifications in Business, Logistics, or a related field preferred.
Strong commercial acumen, strategic thinking and a collaborative mindset.
Why Apply?
This is a genuine opportunity to step into a newly created role with high visibility and broad scope. You'll join a business that’s stable, profitable and investing heavily in its future - and with Supply Chain front and centre. If you're looking to shape and influence a critical function, build out capability, and continue building a best in class operation, this is a great opportunity for consideration.

For a confidential conversation, contact Lewis Ironside - lironside@sharpandcarter.com.au | 0435 824 108

The Sr Program Analyst plays a key strategic role in shaping and implementing a technology vision for Cell Care Australia. This involves aligning technology initiatives with the broader business strategy while ensuring seamless integration with international parent organisations. The role encompasses oversight of the Technology department, leading software development for solutions both locally and in the US and Canada and may also include managing associated staff and project teams to drive innovation and operational excellence.

Technology Leadership

Develop and implement a technology vision and strategy aligned with business growth and global objectives.

Oversee the planning, development, and implementation of IT solutions across local and global operations.

Manage and optimise the technology infrastructure, ensuring security, efficiency, and business continuity.

Lead solution architecture, software development, database design, software integration, and IT project management.

Ensure IT effectiveness and efficiency by delivering strategic information technology solutions both locally and globally.

Oversee the customisation and integration of business-critical applications such as Salesforce, SharePoint, and MS Access, Master Control, Mulesoft.

Lead the development of reporting and analytic frameworks to support business decision-making.

Provide IT support and vendor management for third-party applications and platforms.

Ensure adherence to IT policies, procedures, risk management, and governance standards.

Manage the IT budget, ensuring cost-effective allocation of resources and strategic investments.

Lead and oversee project management efforts, ensuring project deliverables are met on time and within budget.

Provide executive and management reports on IT initiatives and operational performance.

Global Strategic Collaboration

Serve as the primary liaison between Cell Care Australia and Cooper Surgical US, ensuring smooth collaboration on technology and operational initiatives.
Facilitate knowledge exchange, innovation, and integration across global teams.

Other Features of Job: 

Problem-solving and troubleshooting of day-to-day IT and operational issues.
Database administration and optimisation.
Vendor management, ensuring smooth delivery of third-party solutions.
Cross-functional collaboration with finance, operations, and global IT teams.
 
Strong knowledge of technology strategy, solution architecture, and software development in a laboratory, healthcare, or biotech environment.
Exposure to LIMS (Laboratory Information Management Systems) or other laboratory IT solutions.
Expertise in enterprise applications such as Salesforce, SharePoint, SQL Server, Visual Studio C#, Mulesoft and MS Access.
Experience leading multi-functional IT teams and managing complex IT implementations and integrations.
Advanced understanding of IT governance, risk management, and compliance within regulated industries.
Strong project management skills, including experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Ability to collaborate with global stakeholders, ensuring alignment with corporate objectives.
Vendor management experience, including contract negotiation and service level agreement oversight.

Strong communication and leadership skills, with the ability to engage executive teams and cross-functional stakeholders.

Preferred Experience

Experience working in a global corporate environment with cross-regional collaboration.
Knowledge of regulatory and compliance frameworks specific to biotechnology, healthcare, or medical devices.
